Transcript:
Kevin: You're right, Lucy. There is another woman. And, no, it's not what you 
think. Trust me. Do you have enough faith in me to do that, despite what you 
think you know? To marry me -- now? Do you trust me enough to believe that I love you and 
I always will? I'm asking, yes or no -- will you marry me?

Lucy: I saw you go into that room with that woman. Room 1215. She was a very, 
very pretty woman. You know, I saw you with her.
Kevin: I'm asking you to trust me in spite of what you think you saw.
Lucy: You're asking me an awful lot, you know that, Doc? An awful lot.

Kevin: Well, if I believed that, I wouldn't be standing here. And I wouldn't 
be asking you. And I wouldn't be feeling that all the magic that's happened here 
tonight wasn't somehow meant to end in you and me finally seizing the day. Don't 
think, Lucy. Feel it. What does the universe tell you? What are your heart and 
your soul telling you?

Lucy: We sure didn't plan this. I mean, neither one of us thought it would be 
like this, right?
Lucy: Just like some big accident or something, right?
Kevin: Right. Except there are no accidents.
Lucy: No, only what is meant to be.

Kevin: And that's what this is, Lucy. This is the one-in-a-million shot that 
you wish and you hope and you pray for, and if you blink, it disappears. Let's 
not blink this time.

Lucy: So what you're asking is you're asking me to trust you completely and 
absolutely. Trust. Well, I do trust you. I don't know what happened in that 
room, 1215, and I don't know what you were doing with that woman, but I do know 
you. You're my Doc. And I know you love me. And, oh, Doc, I love you so much. 
And I also know we weren't really ready before, not until now.

Lucy: Sure. Yeah. I mean, why not? You know, I will. I do. I think I'm going 
to -- let's get married right now, right here!

Alison: Do you think that Lucy has any idea that this is going to be more 
than just a wedding?
Rafe: Not a clue, but she's about to find out.

Lucy: Wait a minute. Whoa-whoa, whoa, whoa. What am I doing standing around 
here? I got to go -- I got to go, you know, make myself pretty or something -- 
hey.
Lucy: Would you get Serena? Maybe you could help her get ready?
Livvie: Yeah! Yeah, yeah! I'll go find her right now.

Victor: You're going to need something old. Maybe I could walk you down the 
aisle.
Lucy: Oh, Victor, I'd be so honored.

Mary: But you still need something new, something borrowed, and something 
blue.

Lucy: Oh, you're right! Forget all that! I don't have anybody to perform the 
ceremony. We don't have anybody.
Kevin: Not so fast. Rev. Giovanni, raise your hand. There he is!

Kevin: Yeah, for an unplanned wedding, we seem to have pretty much everything 
we need.
Don: No, no, save it for the wedding.
Kevin: Hey, mind your own business.
Don: You got to get going.
Don: That way. I'll meet you there.
Mac: Yeah, it's true, I get to be your best man.
Mac: Oh. I'm so happy for you, Kevin.
Kevin: Thanks for hanging in there with me.
Eve: So you're going through with it, huh?
Eve: Well, I wish you all the best.
Kevin: I wish the same thing for you.
Chris: Hello? Hello? Come on, say something, would you, please?
Livvie: Good thing you wore a white dress.

Lucy: Well, I sort of didn't start out that way. It just -- the white dress 
showed up.
Livvie: And I think it -- yes, it totally goes on the back of your dress.
Lucy: Oh, it's gorgeous. It's so gorgeous.

Lucy: Look at this. These are both exquisite. I can't believe it. Where would 
they come from?

Lucy: The universe. Oh, who cares? You know what this means? If I had any 
doubts before, I certainly don't now.
Livvie: Well, that takes care of something new.
Serena: You still need something borrowed and something blue.

Lucy: Oh, dear, I do. You know, I'm going to need all the good-luck charms I 
can get. What am I going to do?
Livvie: Come with me. I think I -- I do. I have an idea.

Lucy: Yeah. I guess you're thinking I'm sort of a little crazy here, just up 
and saying yes like that after --
Ian: I think you're -- you're an incredible woman.

Ian: And you trust in the one you love, and that makes Kevin a very lucky 
guy.

Lucy: Thanks. You know, Kevin and I, we found our way back to each other, so 
I know you and Eve can do the same thing.
Serena: I don't know what I'm going to do. I can't find anything blue.
Rafe: Ok, now, have a seat, milady. Ahem.
Alison: Yeah. Well, I didn't have that on when I left my house.
Rafe: Well, sometimes you just got to improvise.
Lucy: Oh, my goodness, it's another miracle. Now all we need is something --

Livvie: Something borrowed. I just remembered that my dad gave these to me 
for my birthday, and I just think they would look really beautiful with your 
dress.

Lucy: Oh, Livvie. Thank you so much. Well, it looks like I have absolutely 
everything -- I hope.
Jack: Excuse me. Candles coming through.
Jack: Excuse me, excuse me. Frank.
Jack: Yeah. You know what? There's one more in the lobby.

Eve: I'm looking for the bracelet that you gave me for Christmas. I lost it. 
I lost it just like I lose everything.

Ian: Come here. Whatever we've lost, we'll get it back. I promise you. We'll 
get it back.
Alison: So you're pretty proud of yourself, now, aren't you?

Rafe: I guess I am. And that's what it's all about, right -- people coming 
together, being with the ones they love, right?

Alison: But it's not done yet. And like you said, the best thing is yet to 
come.
Lucy: Ok, ladies, this is it, right?
Lucy: I'll see you out there.
Lucy: I love you, sweet pea.

Chris: Excuse me. I think someone here at your hotel is trying to reach me on 
my cell phone, but they keep getting disconnected. So if you could just maybe let 
me take a peek at the phone records?
Clerk: I'm sorry, sir. We can't let you do that.

Chris: No, I understand, see, but I'm a doctor, and it's probably a patient 
of mine who needs my help. Yeah. No, ok, listen --

Chris: You know, maybe you could stop being such a tight-ass drone and 
cooperate?

Chris: Ok, ok. How about this -- if you don't show me the records, I'm going 
to start 
tearing this place apart starting with you. How's that? Thank you. There it is. 
That's my number. Someone from 1215 has been calling me. I knew it. 1215, 1215 
-- why is that number so familiar?
Chris: That was a rhetorical question, Mr. Helper.

Rev. Giovanni: Please be seated. Dearly beloved, we're gathered together here 
in the presence of God and of this company that Lucy and Kevin may be united in 
holy matrimony. We're here to celebrate and to share in the glorious act that 
God is about to perform, the act by which he converts their love for one another 
into the holy and sacred estate of marriage. I'd like the couple to begin by 
exchanging their personal vows. Lucy?

Lucy: Oh. Excuse me, Reverend. You see, this really wasn't planned, so we 
don't really have any preplanned vows --
Rev. Giovanni: I suggest you wing it.

Lucy: Ok. Um -- Doc, I just mentioned to the reverend that we don't have any 
preplanned vows, and you know what he said? "Wing it." So that's what 
I guess 
I'm going to do. Boy.

Lucy: I guess there's something to be said for that old adage -- try, try, 
try, try and keep on trying again. Ok. Here it goes. I have waited to be 
standing up here next to you like this for what seems like forever. I've dreamed 
about this day, and I know you have, too. And now that it's finally here, and 
we're really going to do this, I look at your face and everything that has come 
between us before, everything, it just seems like it's completely disappeared. 
And all that's left is the one truth that we've always had between us forever -- 
our love for each other. Oh, doc, that -- that love, I guess, when you think 
about it, is all that really matters, isn't it? And our love is so real and so 
strong, I know that it can get us through anything. So standing here right now 
looking at you, I want to say thank you. Thank you for reminding me of that. And 
thank you for making me believe in our love again. I love you.
Lucy: Uh -- no -- wait -- I'm -- I'm not quite finished.
Rev. Giovanni: Oh, I beg your pardon. Go ahead.

Lucy: Ok, thank you. I just want to say that I know when we look at each 
other, it seems like we've known each other forever and ever, but today -- 
tonight -- we start down a whole new road because our future is limitless 
together, just like the universe. And I just can't wait to see where that road takes 
us together, forever.
Kevin: Wow. Not bad for winging it. What she said.
Kevin: Lucy. You really think I don't have something to say?

Kevin: Lucy, you taught me that life should be nothing less than a grand 
adventure, that there are always mountains to climb and mysteries to solve and 
new worlds to explore. And I cannot tell you how glad I am for that because you 
also taught me that opening my heart and listening to my soul is the key to 
being alive. And life with you is the grandest adventure of all. And I'm glad 
because for the first time, I can actually look forward to growing old because I know in my heart that you'll even make that fun. 
I love you, Lucy. I love you. 
And I'm going to spend the rest of my days making you happier than you ever 
dreamed possible. Starting with tonight. Are you ready for that?
Lucy: Oh, boy. I am so ready.
Rev. Giovanni: Let me just do this first.

Rev. Giovanni: Into the holy estate of marriage these two persons are about 
to be joined. If anyone can show just cause why they may not lawfully be joined 
together, let them now speak or else forever hold their peace. Let me have the 
rings.
Lucy: What is it? What's wrong?

Lucy: Do what are -- what are you doing? I thought we had everything settled. 
Didn't we work everything --
Kevin: Shh, shh, shh, shh. Trust me, Lucy. Trust me.

Lucy: Well, I -- I want to trust you, but if you don't tell me what the heck 
is going on right now, I am --
Kevin: It's just that not everyone is here.
Lucy: I don't need anybody else.
Kevin: You sure? We don't have a flower girl.

Lucy: Oh, my God. Christina? Oh! Doc, tell me -- is she real? She's really 
real. Is -- is she real?
>> Stay tuned for scenes from the next "Port Charles: Miracles Happen."
Lucy: Julie's back in Port Charles?
Kevin: She came here to give Christina to you. Christina's yours again.
